ygData.subject: Re: Rangers and warriors
ygData.msgSnippet: If they root you pull out a bow until they run out of mana or the root fades.  I dueled a level 23 wizard at level 18, I constantly (I mean constantly)
ygData.messageBody:
If they root you pull out a bow until they run out of mana or the root
fades. I dueled a level 23 wizard at level 18, I constantly (I mean
constantly) interrupted her until she got a shadow step off and then rooted
me. Silly me I then forgot to pull my bow out.

> ----------
> From: Jason Coan[SMTP:COANJ@...]
> Reply To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
> Sent: Wednesday, May 26, 1999 12:49 AM
> To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [warriors_eq] Rangers and warriors
>
> From: "Jason Coan" <COANJ@...>
>
> in beta I dueled many wizards. Simply put, if they use root, warrior
> dies, unless you get real lucky and resist a lot. In many of the duels,
> since they were just for fun and mainly with friends, they agreed not to
> use root. The results were rather surprising. If they tried to use their
> big damage spells I would usually win due to a couple resists and couple
> interupts, and just smackin the hell outta them with my GZ. BUT if the
> wiz would use lower level lightning spells they would win becuase they
> cast so fast I didn't inturupt much, and even if I resisted a few, there
> were a few more on the way.
>
> >>> "Mifsud, Michael" <Michael.Mifsud@...> 5.25.99 3:26:48 AM >>>
> From: "Mifsud, Michael" <Michael.Mifsud@...>
>
> Ever compared an equal level warrior and wiz?
>
> If the wiz unloads on the warrior using his meanest spells then sit and
> meds, the warrior will do about the same amount of damage as the wiz takes
> to unload then med.
>
> > ----------
> > From: schlaban yocksovik[SMTP:anonymaste@...]
> > Reply To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
> > Sent: Tuesday, May 25, 1999 4:34 PM
> > To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
> > Subject: Re: [warriors_eq] Rangers and warriors
> >
> > From: "schlaban yocksovik" <anonymaste@...>
> >
> > Who cares what damage a warrior does at 35+
> > That is not our role......suck it up...all of the damage.
> > That is what you are here for.
> > Try doin more damage then a wiz or a mate.....I think not.
> >
> > Warriors ar not the ones to dish out the damage....at lower levels yea
> but
> >
> > at higer levels we just keep em occupied.
> > IMHO
> >
> > Vashi, Eternal warriors
> >
> > >>From: <slu@...>
> > >
> > >Tom
> > >
> > >Yup & the gap seems to get worse the higher in levels you go. Not only
>
> > >Rangers, but Paladins & especially Monks seem to greatly diminish the
> > role
> > >of the warrior at levels 25+. Eventually the other classes have
> similar
> > >(within a couple of 100 hps) stats and much more diversity in terms of
> > >healing & hth damage capability. Mind you that my opinion is based on
> > >talking with high level players (who have tried to convince me to dump
> my
> >
> > >warrior) & from reading on the eqstratics site.
> > >
> > >There is an interesting thread on the eqstratics board (warriors)
> > regarding
> > >the perceived lack of differentiation (or all out weakness) of our
> class
> > at
> > >higher levels.
> > >
> > >What does the rest of the list think? Anyone have direct experience
> > >playing these classes at level 30+ & can compare HTH damage &
> > effectiveness
> > >against critters?
> > >
> > >Rob Wilbarg aka Flair in Fennin Ro
> > >
> > > > ** Original Subject: [warriors_eq] Rangers and warriors
> > > > ** Original Sender: "Tom Swift" <tswift@...>
> > > > ** Original Date: Mon, 24 May 1999 12:26:45 -0400
> > >
> > > > ** Original Message follows...
> > >
> > > >
> > > > This past week I decided to take a break from my level 15 dark elf
> > >warrior. I was abit frustrated.
> > > >
> > > > I started a half-elf warrior in Kelethin. It is insanely easy to
> play
> >
> > >there. I made level 5 in about 3.5 hours. Then I stopped and tried a
> > wood
> > >elf ranger. Has anyone else played a ranger? I imagine it is the most
>
> > >poorly balanced of all the hybrids. After 4 hours I reached level 5
> and
> > >got kick. I am now 12-18 hours into the character and almost level 9.
> I
> >
> > >am just as capable as an equivalent warrior. Next level I gain an
> array
> > of
> > >spells which will boost my combat effectiveness and allow me to heal.
> > Part
> > >of the easy success is the plethora of low level orcs available a
> stone's
> >
> > >throw from Kelethin. With my tracking ability I am never at a loss for
>
> > >targets and I can engage blue con orcs in rapid succession or even 2 at
> a
> >
> > >time. I can even engage and successfully beat yellow con orcs more than
> > 50%
> > >of the time and almost always can kill orcs that con even to me without
>
> > >trouble. So far it seems that I get as many hit points now as my
> warrior
> > >did.
> > > >
> > > > My point is, with a ranger class as powerful a combatant as it is I
> > see
> > >little necessity for the pure warrior. I am going to play through to
> > level
> > >15 I think, just to see a more even comparison. My concern is only
> from
> > a
> > >game mechanics perspective though as I have no doubt my playing as a
> dark
> >
> > >elf was a much more rewarding experience. Has anyone else noticed that
> > the
> > >warrior just is not different enough from the hybrid fighter classes?
> > > >
> > > > Bael Aelyn
> > > > Warrior of the 15th Order or Ranger of the 8th
> Rank
> > > > Indigo Brotherhood Humble Servant of
> > >Tunare
> > > >
> > > > still undecided
> > > >
> > >
> > >
> > > >** --------- End Original Message ----------- **
> > >
> > > >
> > >
> > >
> > >
> >
